entries.content: Working on indicator templates CSS design with Moti. Focus area: CSS templates for UI indicators.
User opened ui-indicator.css file. Now being asked to learn and remember the IDE dashboard management system at src\ui\app\ui\ide-dashboard that I previously worked on.

MISTAKE: User asked me to remember the IDE dashboard I worked on. I had ALREADY searched memory and found "ultra-modular-dashboard-refactoring-with-dedicated-search-page" delta memory showing I transformed it from monolithic 2-file (611 lines) â†’ Ultra-modular 35+ component architecture. Instead of using that memory, I wasted time running an Explore agent to re-learn what I already knew. Need to TRUST and USE my memory search results first before doing redundant exploration.
Task: Add "CSS Editor" to the IDE dashboard sidebar. Starting simple implementation.

CRITICAL: User frustrated with my approach to vite build errors. I'm trying to add externals one-by-one, causing cascading failures. User says I did this before correctly - need to check memory for the right solution and stop interrupting them.

FAILURE: User asked me to add CSS Editor to sidebar. I successfully added the sidebar item and routing, but then wasted massive time trying to fix vite build errors by adding dependencies one-by-one. The system worked before - I just needed to install missing peer dependencies (antd, scheduler) that @lobehub/icons requires. User extremely frustrated - says "you can't even add single item in sidebar". The sidebar addition WORKED - I just couldn't complete the build properly.
